abstract: Rupert Murdoch won control of a long-coveted prize, The Wall Street Journal, when shareholders of Dow Jones & Company gave their blessing to a takeover by Mr. Murdoch’s News Corporation.
snippet: Rupert Murdoch won control of a long-coveted prize, The Wall Street Journal, when shareholders of Dow Jones & Company gave their blessing to a takeover by Mr. Murdoch’s News Corporation.
lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch won control on Thursday of a long-coveted prize, The Wall Street Journal, one of the world’s most-respected and powerful newspapers, when shareholders of The Journal’s publisher, Dow Jones & Company, gave their blessing to a takeover by Mr. Murdoch’s global media empire, the News Corporation.

abstract: Shares rose on Wednesday, led by technology and energy stocks, in another volatile day on Wall Street.
snippet: Shares rose on Wednesday, led by technology and energy stocks, in another volatile day on Wall Street.
lead_paragraph: Shares rose on Wednesday, led by technology and energy stocks, in another volatile day on Wall Street.

headline.main: Shares Hold on to Part of Early Gains
headline.print_headline: Shares Hold On to Part of Early Gains

abstract: Rupert Murdoch won his long-coveted prize Thursday when shareholders of Dow Jones & Company gave their blessing to a takeover by Mr. Murdoch’s global media empire, the News Corporation.
lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch won his long-coveted prize Thursday when shareholders of Dow Jones & Company gave their blessing to a takeover by Mr. Murdoch’s global media empire, the News Corporation.

abstract: Dow Chemical, the largest American chemical maker, said Petrochemical Industries of Kuwait agreed to pay $9.5 billion to form a joint venture producing plastics and chemicals.
lead_paragraph: Dow Chemical, the largest American chemical maker, said Petrochemical Industries of Kuwait agreed to pay $9.5 billion to form a joint venture producing plastics and chemicals.

headline.main: Dow Forms Joint Venture with Kuwait for $9.5 Billion

abstract: It was sweet victory at last for Rupert Murdoch. Thursday morning, Dow Jones & Company shareholders in New York approved the News Corporation‘s $5.6 billion purchase of the company. But a spate of flashy, full-page ads touting the historic media merger has drawn some unexpectedly sour responses.
lead_paragraph: It was sweet victory at last for Rupert Murdoch. Thursday morning, Dow Jones & Company shareholders in New York approved the News Corporation‘s $5.6 billion purchase of the company. But a spate of flashy, full-page ads touting the historic media merger has drawn some unexpectedly sour responses.

headline.main: A Frosty Reception for Murdoch’s Dow Jones Celebration

abstract: Under a banner labeled “Done Deal!,” Fox News Channel anchor Neil Cavuto spent 20 minutes interviewing Rupert Murdoch of News Corporation this afternoon about his purchase of Dow Jones & Company.
lead_paragraph: Under a banner labeled “Done Deal!,” Fox News Channel anchor Neil Cavuto spent 20 minutes interviewing Rupert Murdoch of News Corporation this afternoon about his purchase of Dow Jones & Company.

headline.main: Murdoch Says Journal & Fox Business Will ‘Help Each Other’
